humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " hand " and " army ", the original meaning is dancing and shaking. "Said Wen": "Fen Ye. From the hand, the sound of the army." Han Chen Lin "Book for Cao Hong and Wei Wen Di": "He has tens of thousands of fine armors. "

" Waiting " can be described as whistling. Song Li handed in the "Xinshihuiyuan·Hanlin Yuan Chengzhi": "Chinese and foreign appearances are sparsely criticized, or edicts are issued from them, Chen Han also pays him to review, which is called grass."

" Waiting " also means driving away. Tang Hanyu's "Preface to Sending Master Wen Chang to the Buddha": "People who have a Confucian name, but those who are motivated by ink...whirl at the door wall, and enter at Yidi.

" Wave " also means command. "The Yang Family" Chapter 23: "Rokuro plays Langqian and Langwan plays."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " hand " and " army ", the original meaning is dancing and shaking.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「軍」聲，本義為舞動、搖動。《說文》：「奮也。从手，軍聲。」漢陳琳〈為曹洪與魏文帝書〉：「彼有精甲數萬，臨高守要，一人揮戟，萬夫不得進。」

　　「揮」可謂揮毫書寫。宋李上交《近事會元‧翰林院承旨》：「中外表疏批答，或詔從中出，宸翰所揮，亦資其檢討，謂之視草。」

　　「揮」也表示驅趕。唐韓愈〈送浮屠文暢師序〉：「人固有儒名而墨行者……在門牆則揮之，在夷狄則進之。」

　　「揮」還表示指揮。《楊家將》第23回：「六郎揮郎千、郎萬出戰。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「軍」聲，本義為舞動、搖動。
